alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:08PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE NORTHERN SIERRA, WESTERN NEVADA, AND NORTHEAST CALIFORNIA THROUGH 10 PM PDT... * Showers and thunderstorms are possible through 10 PM PDT this evening for areas mainly north of US-50 in the northern Sierra, western Nevada, and northeast California. Thunderstorms are likely to be more isolated and short-lived. * Potential hazards near any thunderstorms that develop include brief heavy rainfall, gusty outflow winds to 40 mph, small hail, and cloud-to-ground lightning. * Thunderstorms that form over area lakes could produce choppy waters, which could capsize small watercraft and cause hazardous conditions for swimmers. If recreating outdoors, have quick access to shelter if you hear thunder. Remain sheltered for at least 30 minutes past the last rumble of thunder to be safe.

area.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California
